1. Timolol: This is a chemical entity. It is a beta-adrenergic antagonist (beta blocker) used to lower intraocular pressure in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.
2. Pilocarpine: This is another chemical entity. It is a cholinergic agonist used to lower intraocular pressure in patients with glaucoma.

Therefore, the chemical entities in the paragraph are timolol and pilocarpine.
